lines.text: Hello. What's a nice girl like you doing with an old cow?
I'm taking her to the bull.
Well couldn't your father do that?
No it must the the bull.
My name's Muggins.
That doesn't surprise me.
Joan may think you're a gentleman but personally I've got sore misgivings.
You ought to put some talcum powder on them.
Hello darling, Oh No.
Hello Peter darling, I'm just checking on the camping gear.
So I see.
Did you have a good day?
Oh not bad, got drunk at lunchtime, went to a strip club and ended up in bed with a popsy.
Barbara dear, do you think your quite suitably dressed for travelling?
Oh but sir, we were told to bring the minimum of clothing.
Oh dear, the ram's loose.
That's not the only one!
Ahh matron what can I do for you?
I'm sorry to trouble you Doctor Soaper, but I've been thinking about this camping trip for the girls who have to remain with us for the rest of the holidays.
What about it?
I was wondering whether it was really such a good idea?
Perhaps you were forgetting Matron it was my idea.
Oh no no, of course it is an absolutely splendid one but...
But what?
Well I was wondering whether they might find it a trifle spartan them being such delicate and refined girls.
The point I'm really trying to make is that here I can jeep full control of them, outside anything might happen.
You seem to be forgetting Miss Haggerd you're coming with us surely you and I can keep suitable control.

[Romantically]
Well I was thinking of the girls...
So was I.
Oh. But don't you see it raises the problem of sex?
I wouldn't dream of bothering you in that way.
No I meant with the girls they are likely to come in to contact with boys.
Oh yes. I don't think that will be a problem. It has been my experience as once young people sample the lights of country life and the wonders of nature they just can't get enough of it.
Exactly.
Well I was thinking of the girls...
So was I.
Exactly.
Are you going to stay with us all the time?
Oh yeah, I go all the way!
Oh I bet you do...
Miss Dobbin, what's the meaning of this?
I'm sorry sir but the gentlemen kept touching things.
Yes she was showing me how to stick the pole up.

[on disturbing Matron in the shower]
Matron, this is the *men's*!
Go away, Doctor Soaper!
I don't think a shower stall is the place for making advances!
I thought I got hold on the shower tap!

[after Barbara asks about fertility rights]
A fine talk you must have given them on the birds and the bees.
Well, when I started talking, I realized I had no idea what they do. What do bees do?
They sting!

[Sid has taken Joan to the cinema to see a nudist film]
You told me this film was all about camping!
It is. They've got tents, haven't they?
That's not what you're looking at!

[shocked at seeing Babs' bikini top fly off as he takes the girls through their exercises]
Matron, take them away!
How about those two things sticking out in front?
Yeah! How about 'em!
Saucy!
Don't rush me. I think you'll find it's worth waiting for.
So's Christmas but you won't find me stuffing your turkey!
